_info: Title of the color editor panel
Title bar of the sprite importer dialog
Title of the "Input files" section of the dialog
Button that brings up the file select dialog for input sprites
Info label showing how many sprites will be imported
Title of the "Placement" section of the dialog

en: The way in which sprites will be placed once imported.

The method used for placing sprites.
Append: add sprites at the end. Existing sprites are not affected.
Replace: replaces as many sprites as are being imported, starting at the set position. Excess sprites are appended.
Insert: inserts sprites at the set position. Sprites that come after will be moved, affecting existing cells.
What position to replace/insert sprites at.

_info: Placement info label at the bottom of the section
en: Waiting for files to be selected.

Will not replace sprites.
Total sprites after import: {total}

Will REPLACE {replace} sprite(s)!
Total sprites after import: {total}

Will not displace sprites.
Total sprites after import: {total}

Will DISPLACE {displace} sprite(s)!
Total sprites after import: {total}

_info: Title of the "Palette" section of the dialog

en: Set how to handle the palettes of imported sprites here.

Whether to include the palette of imported sprites.
Embedded palettes are ignored by 'Player' sprites, but required by everything else.
If the input sprite has a palette, this setting will halve its alpha channel (transparency) values.

_info: Title of the "Sprite" section of the dialog

en: Configure additional processing to apply to imported sprites here.

_info:
CheckButton that toggles red channel as color index
(-as-rgb parameter in Ghoul)

en:
If checked, sprites will be treated as RGB images,
and the color index of each pixel will be obtained
from its red channel, rather than the input pixel's
actual color index.
Whether to reindex input sprites, changing the order of their color groups from 1-2-3-4 to 1-3-2-4 or vice-versa.

Whether to modify the bit depth of imported sprites (note that resulting depth will always be at least 4 bpp).
No change: bit depth will be left as-is.
Force 4-bit: bit depth will be brought down to 4 bpp (16 colors) if higher.
Force 8-bit: bit depth will be brought up to 8 bpp (256 colors) if lower.
Sets the imported sprite to preview.
Sets the palette to preview sprites with.

_info: Message when trying to preview an invalid sprite file.
en:
The file was not found or is not a valid sprite.
{file}

_info: Import button at the bottom of the dialog

en: Click to begin importing sprites with the above settings.

_info: Cancel button in the confirmation dialog
Title bar of the sprite exporter dialog
Title of the "Sprite range" section of the dialog

en:
Select the range of sprites to export here.
To export only one sprite, set both boxes to the same value.

_info: Starting sprite in export range, spinbox title

en: Sets the starting sprite of the export range.

_info: Ending sprite in export range, spinbox title

en: Sets the ending sprite of the export range.

Select formats to export to here.
Nothing will be exported unless you select at least one.

Exports a binary sprite in the same format it is found in in the game's files.
Supports palettes with transparency.
Analogous to extracting sprites with a hex editor.

_info: Title for uncompressed bin export (keep "BIN" as-is)

en:
Export an uncompressed binary sprite.
Supports palettes with transparency.
These work in game, but are not recommended.
Export a RAW file that can be used as a PalMod preview.

Export an indexed PNG.
Supports palettes with transparency.

Export an indexed BMP.
Supports palettes, but not transparency.

_info: Title of the "Palette" section of the dialog

en: Choose how to handle palettes for exported sprites here.

_info: CheckButton that toggles including palette on export

en: Whether to include a palette at all.

_info: spinbox that selects which palette is used on export

en: Which palette number to apply to exported sprites.

Ways in which to alter the alpha of exported sprites.
Do nothing: alpha will be left as-is.
Double: double alpha of all colors.
Halve: halve alpha of all colors.
Make opaque: turn all colors completely solid.

_info: Title of the "Miscellaneous" section of the dialog
CheckButton that toggles reindexing on export

en:
Reindex output sprites, changing the order of their
color groups from 1-2-3-4 to 1-3-2-4 and vice-versa.

Only applies to 8 bpp sprites.

_info: CheckButton that toggles naming files from 0

en:
By default, exported sprites will be named according to their original indices.
Enabling this setting will cause exported sprites to always be named 'sprite_0', 'sprite_1', 'sprite_2', etc.
Set the exported sprite to preview.

_info: Export button at the bottom of the dialog

en: Click to begin exporting sprites with the above settings.

_info: Title bar of the sprite delete dialog
Title of the "Range" section of the dialog

en:
Select the range of sprites to delete here.
To delete only one sprite, set both boxes to the same value.

_info: Starting sprite in delete range, title

en: Sets the starting sprite of the range to delete.

_info: Ending sprite in delete range, title

en: Sets the ending sprite of the range to delete.

_info: Title of the "Miscellaneous" section of the dialog
CheckButton that toggles cell sprite index redirection

en:
ON: After deleting, automatically adjust the sprite index
for cells whose sprites were displaced, so that they don't
visually change.

Cells pointing to now-deleted sprites will have their
sprite index set back to 0.

OFF: Do not adjust cells after deleting sprites. If a cell's
sprite index is still within the bounds of the sprite array,
don't change it. If it's out of bounds, clamp it.

_info: Info text at the bottom, above the delete button
Delete button at the bottom of the dialog

en: Click to delete sprites with the above settings.

_info: spinbox that selects a preview sprite, title

en: Use this preview to check what sprites will be deleted.

_info: Title bar of the confirmation dialog
Title bar of the dialog saying you can't delete all sprites
Main text for the above dialog
en:
Cannot delete all sprites! Object needs at least 1.
Consider importing new sprites to replace the old ones.

Tooltips for the cell toolbar's buttons
en: Delete a single cell or a range of cells.

Add a new cell before the current one.

Add a new cell after the current one.
Displaces cells after it!

Paste the cell in the clipboard as a new cell after the current one.

_info: Onion skin cell index spinbox, title

en:
Selects which cell to display an onion skin in the preview for.
Set this to '-1' to disable the onion skin.

_info: Checkbutton that toggles onion skins in front

en: Toggles whether the onion skin should appear behind or in front of the current cell's sprite.

_info: Title of the "Sprite Info" section of the editor.

en: These values control how cells display sprites.
Controls which sprite number this cell will display in game.

Controls the sprite's horizontal offset for this cell.
Click to change the control type.

Controls the sprite's vertical offset for this cell.
Click to change the control type.
Flips type 6 sprite cutouts vertically as the mode 1 VISUAL instruction does.

_info: Title of the "Boxes" section of the editor

en:
This section controls the boxes for this cell.
Modifying them will cause desyncs in online matches and old replays!

Toggles whether to display boxes at all.
They can't be edited while hidden.

Toggles box editing on/off.
Editing boxes will cause desyncs in online matches and old replays!

_info: Menubutton that toggles box types for display

en: Controls which types of boxes will be displayed in the preview.

_info: Tooltip for the itemlist containing the cell's hitboxes
en: The list of boxes contained in this cell.
Sets the type of selected boxes.
Sets the selected box's horizontal offset.
Sets the selected box's vertical offset.
Moves the cropped sprite region to the right, 8 pixels at a time.
Moves the cropped sprite region down, 8 pixels at a time.
Set the palette to preview sprites with.

Click: Select colors
Shift + click: Add to selection
Shift + right click: Remove from selection
CTRL + C: Copy
CTRL + V: Paste
CTRL: Preview paste
Tab: Swap selection mode (box/range)
Escape: Clear selection
